description: From Middle English aketon, from Old French aqueton, auqueton, alqueton, from Old Spanish alcoton (modern algodón), from Arabic الْقُطْن‎ (al-quṭn), definite of قُطْن‎ (quṭn, “cotton”). Doublet of cotton.

entries.meaning: (historical) A stuffed jacket worn under the mail, or (later) a jacket plated with mail.
